intro: Sarcinula acanthodes, commonly known as the spiny sarcinula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions with sandy soils and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems covered in sharp, spiny structures. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Sarcinula acanthodes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
